info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 14 at 5:03PM EDT until June 14 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh PA
info.description:
FFWPBZ
The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... Northern Preston County in northeastern West Virginia... Eastern Monongalia County in northern West Virginia...
* Until 800 PM EDT.
* At 503 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1.5 to 3 inches in 30 minutes could lead to an additional 0.5 to 1.5 inches of rain in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Morgantown, Westover, Kingwood, Star City, Granville, Newburg, Brookhaven, Cassville, Reedsville, Masontown, Albright, Browns Chapel, Cheat Lake, Gladesville, Booth, Osage, Everettville, Valley Point, Georgetown and Crown.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
